intro: Scariola eburnea, commonly known as the white scariola, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Scariola eburnea is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
